episodes.title: Speaking of Cults...Foundations of Cult Recovery ft. Christian Szurko
episodes.description: This week I welcome Christian Szurko, a cult recovery consultant who has been helping people in their post-cult life for as many decades as I've been alive! Christian and I discuss key principles of cult indoctrination and recovery in this episode. Enjoy! Christian's website: https://dialogcentre.org.uk/

episodes.title: Speaking of Cults...Jonestown: Paradise Undone
episodes.description: This week I welcome guest Annie Dawid, author and professor of creative writing here in Colorado. In this very wide-ranging episode we discuss the history, psychology and life of Jim Jones and the People's Temple as described in a historical fiction novel that Annie wrote. Enjoy! Annie Dawid's website: https://www.anniedawid.com/

episodes.title: Speaking of Cults...Post-Cult Trauma and Conflicts
episodes.description: In this week's episode, I am joined by Dr. Laura Anderson, a religious trauma specialist who has written When Religion Hurts You and who treats clients overcoming difficult experiences with religion. We discuss post-cult trauma and how this can affect ex-cult communities as well. Enjoy! Dr. Anderson's websites: https://drlauraeanderson.com/ https://www.traumaresolutionandrecovery.com/

episodes.title: Speaking of Cults...Scientology’s Rocky Future
episodes.description: For our second episode of Speaking of Cults, I am joined by Alexander Barnes-Ross aka @ApostateAlex, fellow YouTuber and former Scientologist for a deep dive discussion on how David Miscavige has been recycling the same "weird trick" for decades now and one way or another, things are going to come to a head with his most important supporters if something doesn't change. Enjoy!

episodes.title: Speaking of Cults...Let’s Go Over Cult Basics
episodes.description: Welcome to the first episode of the rebranded Sensibly Speaking podcast, now re-titled and re-purposed as the Speaking of Cults podcast. This podcast remains on the same website and RSS stream as the previous one, so you shouldn't have to change anything as an audio subscriber.  This week we review all the basics of what a destructive cult is (and isn't) and how coercive control plays a part, plus we clear up common misconceptions about cults. Enjoy!

episodes.title: This Podcast is Ending (kind of)
episodes.description: This week I am talking about the fact I'm taking a break for December on a bunch of my work, including this podcast and that when it comes back in January it will have a new name and branding. Details of this and a lot more personal stuff that's been going on recently are gone over. Enjoy!

episodes.title: Scientology, Coverups and Real Crimes ft. Mirriam Francis
episodes.description: This week I am joined by former Scientologist Mirriam Francis, whose story was featured on Scientology and the Aftermath, to discuss her experiences being raised in the Sea Org, escaping and what recovery has been like for her, including her involvement with the justice system for the abuse she endured at the hands of a family member. This is a tough but educational story about the lengths a cult will go to in hiding up its crimes.

episodes.title: Overcoming Childhood Religious Trauma ft. Dr. Darrel Ray
episodes.description: This week I am joined by Dr. Darrel Ray - psychologist, researcher, author and President of the Recovering from Religion Foundation - to discuss childhood religious trauma, why it exists and why it can be so life destroying. This is not an anti-religious screed - it is a psychological fact and one that we have to deal with if we want happy, successful children. Enjoy!

episodes.title: BONUS - Scientology Protest in the UK
episodes.description: We are posting a special bonus podcast episode this week as we didn't want to wait to get this interview out. Here we talk about the big protest staged by Apostate Alex with the help of Jeff Beaumont (PTS for Life) and others, what happened over the three days and why Scientology and David Miscavige definitely took notice. Enjoy!

episodes.title: Psychedelics, Jolly West and Scientology ft. Jon Atack
episodes.description: This week I am joined by Jon Atack to finally have that talk about psychedelics, cult recovery and the drugs which can help bring about extremely altered states of consciousness. This was another wide-ranging discussion where we go deep on the dangers and potentials of drug therapy in moving on from an abusive/cultic experience. Enjoy!

episodes.title: The Scientology Experience in Canada ft. Jeff Beaumont
episodes.description: This week I am joined by Jeff Beaumont, known in the SP TV community as PTS for Life, who has quite a story to tell as a second generation Scientologist raised in a broken home and in and out of the Sea Org more than once. We had an insightful time discussing his experiences and comparing notes on our time in the Sea Org. Enjoy!

episodes.title: The Cult with No Name ft. River Wood
episodes.description: This week I am joined by River Wood to discuss their upbringing in what is known as 2x2s but really is an extremist Christian cult with no official name and hiding in plain sight. We cover a lot of territory and I hope you find it as fascinating as I did. Enjoy!

episodes.title: The Process Church, Manson & Scientology Lore w/Jon Atack
episodes.description: This week I am joined by Jon Atack to discuss and debunk the conspiracy theories surrounding the Process Church, the Son of Sam and Scientology. And when we're done with that, we get into the real facts about Manson's involvement with Scientology. This is a wild one. Enjoy!
subjects: Process Church of the Final Judgement

episodes.title: #407:Cults and Religious Trauma w/Dr. Laura Anderson
episodes.description: This week I welcome Dr. Laura Anderson, psychotherapist and religious trauma expert, to discuss how trauma works, how it is treated and what this has to do with cult members and everyday folks in our day to day life. We cover a lot of territory in this one. Enjoy! Find out more about Dr. Anderson at https://drlauraeanderson.com and check out her new book, When Religion Hurts You.

We cover what "tradcats" are, how sexual and child abuse is not dealt with in Catholicism and why this is absolutely unacceptable. Link to YouTube video of this podcast: https://youtu.be/5iKIszlTS4Y

episodes.title: Scientology Management and Hubbard’s Data Series
episodes.description: This week, I am joined by military intelligence analyst Jeff Wasel and former Wall Street investor John P. Capitalist to take a good hard look at the early days of Scientology management and the formation of the Sea Organization. We discuss L. Ron Hubbard’s activities in Rhodesia and England and how he broke away to form a paramilitary enforcement arm for his church, called the Sea Organization, as well as his evolution of a system of logic and investigation called the Data Series. This is a deeper than usual look at the timeline and events which changed Scientology from an oddball, fringe pseudoscience to an international enterprise which seeks to control every aspect of its members’ lives. Link to my earlier video on the Data Series is here. The post Sensibly Speaking Podcast #136: Scientology Management and Hubbard’s Data Series appeared first on The Sensibly Speaking Podcast.

episodes.title: Sensibly Speaking Podcast #135: The Real History of the Second Amendment
episodes.description:
Here is my breakdown of the history of firearms and the Second Amendment here in the United States, including breaking down why and how it was written in to the Bill of Rights, what the original intent of this amendment was and how it has been interpreted (and misinterpreted) by the Supreme Court and others since then. This podcast will not be my only foray into this subject, but this is probably the most important information anyone one either side of the gun issue needs to make rational decisions about it.

Full transcript of this podcast is available at http://sensiblyspeaking.com

episodes.description:
This week, I interview former spiritual adviser and cult leader Jessica Schab, who one day realized that what she was involved in was not rational and had elements that were actually destructive. We talk about what she did once she realized this and the consequences of those actions. While normally on this channel we have discussed cult followers, in this episode we go to the other side to see what life is like as a cult leader.

IMPORTANT NOTE: This podcast does not endorse Jessica's End of Fear (EOF) Project or any part of the life coaching that she and Diego Fontanive are doing. It is my opinion that anyone partaking in non-professional life coaching services is taking a risk because this is pseudo-psychological work that does not require any professional training or licensing, nor does it have any oversight. Nothing said in this podcast should be taken as a recommendation or endorsement of EOF.

episodes.title: Sensibly Speaking Podcast #113: Helping People Out of Extremist Situations
episodes.description:
This week, I talk to Robert Örell, the Executive Director of Exit at Fryshuset. He has many years of experience working with individuals leaving violent extremist millieus and criminal gangs. Robert is a leading Swedish expert in the field and is involved in several international networks sharing knowledge and best practices in PVE, deradicalisation and exit work. He is an adviser to several NGOs looking to start Exit programs around the world.

Since 2011, Robert is a member of the Steering Comittee of the European Commision's Radicalisation Awareness Network (RAN) where he is co-chair of the EXIT Working Group. Robert has studied Social Education and Psychotherapy. In 2015, he completed a certificate in Terrorism Studies from the University of St. Andrews, UK. See Robert's TEDx Vilnius talk from April 2016: "A way out of violent extremism".

episodes.description:
Ruth McLeod, the Southern Atheist and Chris Shelton, Critical Thinker at Large, riff on news and hot-topic issues using common sense, skepticism and a healthy dose of critical thinking.

This week we wrap up on Kim Davis, talk about Planned Parenthood and Lawrence Krauss and discuss a recent loss.

You can support this podcast as well as my YouTube channel on my Patreon page at http://patreon.com/chrisshelton

You can also use the blue support button on my channel's home page or the PayPal link to provide a one-time support. Thank you very much!!!

episodes.title: The Sensibly Speaking Podcast #1: A New Hope for Podcasting
episodes.description:
This is the premiere episode of The Sensibly Speaking Podcast. Ruth McLeod and I started this podcast last week and a new episode will be released each Saturday. The audio episodes are available on iTunes and at http://sensiblyspeaking.com.  Please subscribe and tell your friends!

There was some back and forth as to whether to setup a new YouTube channel to host these podcasts for YouTube or just post them here and I decided that I would upload them to my channel and create a separate playlist for these. Enjoy!

You can support this podcast as well as my YouTube channel on my Patreon page at http://patreon.com/chrisshelton

You can also use the blue support button on my channel's home page or the PayPal link to provide a one-time support. Thank you very much!!!
